title: Governor Punjab lauds PPP’s historical role in strengthening country’s defence
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jun 21 (APP): Punjab Governor Sardar Saleem Haider Khan, on Saturday paid tribute to Pakistan People Party (PPP) leadership’s pivot role in fortifying the country’s defence, hailing Shaheed Zulfiqar Ali Bhutto’s stance for the country’s nuclear program and Shaheed Benazir who laid the foundation of Pakistan missile technology which has granted success in recent war.
He also praised Bilawal Bhutto’s successful diplomatic efforts which dominated the Pakistan narrative over that of Indian.
The Punjab Governor expressed these views while addressing the ceremony held in connection with 72nd birthday celebration of Shaheed Benazir Bhutto at the National Press Club, Islamabad. Apart from him, Advisor to the Prime Minister and senior party leader Qamar Zaman Kaira, General Secretary of PPP Central Punjab Syed Hassan Murtaza, General Secretary of Women’s Wing Punjab and Member of Provincial Assembly Nargis Faiz Malik, President of PPP Attock Ashar Hayat Khan and a large number of party workers attended the ceremony, said a press release.
The governor further said that the recent victory in the Indo-Pak war was the result of the PPP leadership’s efforts, they made for nuclear program and missile technology.
The entire nation, including the armed forces of Pakistan, deserves congratulations on this victory, he added.
Zulfikar Ali Bhutto laid the foundation of Pakistan nuclear program, when the economic and political challanges were at their peak, Governor recalled, highlighting the stance of Shaheed Zulfiqar Ali Bhutto, remembering stood true to his words.
Similarly, he said, Bibi Shaheed acquisition of missile technology further enhanced the country’s capability, which the world recognizes today.
President Asaf Ali Zardari is the king of reconciliation, he said and added, Bilawal Bhutto Zardari has fulfilled his right to be the heir of Shaheed Zulfikar Ali Bhutto. Due to his successful diplomacy, the whole world has supported Pakistan’s position while rejecting the Indian statement.
Meanwhile, Special Assistant to Prime Minister (SAPM) Qamar Zaman Kaira said PPP leaders are remembered in history for their steadfast commitment to the nation, adding that both President Zardari and Chairman Bilawal are currently playing key roles in strengthening democracy for developed and prosperous Pakistan.
Other speakers also addressed the event.
A documentary highlighting the life and services of Shaheed Benazir Bhutto was also screened at the event.
The ceremony was organized by Sadia Hayat Khan, who joined the party. On this occasion, a cake was also cut for Bibi Shaheed. In his speech, the Governor of Punjab welcomed Sadia Hayat Khan on joining the party.
